meanings.definition: A concluding passage in a musical composition.
meanings.sent1: The symphony ended with a beautiful coda.
meanings.sent2: The pianist played the coda with great emotion.
meanings.sent3: The coda of the song was like the grand finale of a fireworks show.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the coda to a perfect evening.
meanings.sent5: The coda of the play left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The concluding section of a literary or dramatic work.
meanings.sent1: The book's coda tied up all the loose ends.
meanings.sent2: The coda of the movie revealed the fate of the main characters.
meanings.sent3: The coda of the story was unexpected but satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The final scene served as the coda, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The coda of the novel brought closure to the plot.

meanings.sent1: His farewell speech was a touching coda to his time in office.
meanings.sent2: The party's fireworks display was the perfect coda to the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The coda of the meeting was a round of applause for everyone's hard work.
meanings.sent4: The final toast served as the coda to a memorable evening.
meanings.sent5: The coda of the conversation left a lasting impression on everyone present.
